title: How much is discounts of 20%, 10%, and 10% equivalent to a single discount? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the marked price of an article =Rs 100. 1st discount = 20%of Rs.100= Rs 20. Amount payable = 100–20=Rs.80 2nd discount = 10%of Rs.80 = Rs 8. Amount payable=80–8= Rs.72. 3rd. discount =10%of Rs.72 =Rs. 7.20. Thus , single equivalent discount = 20+8+7.20 = 35.2 %. Answer. Second - Method:- Single equivalent discount % = [1 - (1-d1/100).(1-d2/100).(1-d3/100)…….(1- dn/100)]×100. (where d1 , d2 , d3 ,………., dn are the discounts ). = [ 1 - (1–20/100).(1–10/100).(1–10/100)]× 100. = [ 1 - 0.8×0.9×0.9]×100. = [ 1 - 0.648]×100. = [ 0.352]×100. = 35.2 %. Answer

Let price be 100 Discounted price at first discount of 20%=100*80/100=80 Discounted price at second discount of 10%=80*90/100=72 Discounted price at third discount of 10%=72*90/100=63.80 Sum of all 3 doscounts=100–63.80=36.20 Discounts of 20%, 10%, and 10% are equivalent to a single discount of 36.2%
